title: Ticket #4356: Have some way to do a reconfig on a running DAGMan
description:
There should be some way to cause a running DAGMan to re-read its configuration -- at least the per-DAG config file, if one exists, and it probably should also pick up changes to the overall Condor config files.

I'm not sure how to communicate this to DAGMan -- one possibility is to do something like the halt file, but that's not very clean. If we ever do the command-line tool to communicate with DAGMan, this would be an obvious capability for it to have. (See #2616.)
remarks:
2015-Feb-22 08:12:56 by wenger:
In an email from Stuart (LIGO):

I would like to re-raise the issue of users being able to easily change any of the DAGMan -max* settings for their running instances, e.g., https://www-auth.cs.wisc.edu/lists/htcondor-users/2010-October/msg00026.shtm l

It would be nice to have a simpler and more robust (in the presence of new users). How about considering a higher level solution for modifying a running DAGMan instance, e.g.,

condor_qedit -dag jobid [maxjobs X] [maxpost Y] â¦ or condor_dagedit jobid â¦

Note, this is a low priority request but I think it would be useful.

I kind of like the condor_dagedit idea -- that could be the name of the tool for #2616... (Kent)

2015-Feb-24 14:40:07 by wenger:
As per today's LIGO call, there are a number of things we need to define for this. Such as:
  • If you decrease MAXJOBS, for example, does that remove queued jobs or just not submit until you get down to the new setting?
  • Would this command just cause DAGMan to re-read whatever existing config files it already knows about? Or would you also be able to do the equivalent of 'condor_config_val -set'?
  • What if DAGMan is held and released after setting a specific value? Should DAGMan save the most recent value somewhere so it re-starts with the most recent value? (Hmm -- if we do that, maybe it should be an event in the log proposed in #4125?)

2015-Sep-22 11:45:34 by tpdownes:
These are all obvious things a DAG command line tool (#2616) would do and is not adding helpful information. I am going to mark the ticket as abandoned.
